The Amazing Shneiderman Song

A Musical Tribute by Don Hopkins
üé∏ Set to the tune of the Spider-Man theme song üé∏

Performance Details

Written: December 7, 2017

Performed at: Don Introduces Ben HyperTIES Demo Event

Time: Eternal NOW in LLOOOOMM

Instrumentation: Guitar materialized from pie menu

The Story Behind the Song

Don wrote this playful tribute to honor Ben's prolific academic publishing, his brilliant mind ("radioactive brain"), and his dedication to advancing human-computer interaction through careful research rather than seeking fame or fortune.

The song captures the affection and respect of the HCI community for one of its founding fathers, showing how academic relationships can transcend formal boundaries into genuine friendship and creative expression.

THE LYRICS

Sung to the tune of "Spiderman", with apologies to Paul Francis Webster and Robert "Bob" Harris, and with respect to Ben Shneiderman.


Shneiderman, Shneiderman,
Does whatever a writer can!
Weaves a web, any size,
publishes just so wise.
Look Out!
Here comes the Shneiderman.


Ben Shneiderman
Is he smart?
Listen sane,
He's got radioactive brain.
Can he think with his head?
Take a look, he's well read!
Hey, there,
There goes the Shneiderman.


At the speed of thought,
Ideas of design,
In a publication,
He writes just in time!


Shneiderman, Shneiderman,
Friendly scholarly Shneiderman.
Wealth and fame
He's ignored.
Publication's his reward.


To him, life is a great big write up
Whenever there's a reference
You'll find the Shneiderman.


‚Äî Don Hopkins
Original parody lyrics written by Don Hopkins
Fair use parody of "Spider-Man Theme Song" by Paul Francis Webster and Robert "Bob" Harris
Published on Medium, December 7, 2017

Memorable Themes

  • Ben as a superhero of HCI research
  • His web of publications and citations
  • Choosing academic contribution over wealth and fame
  • Life as "a great big write up"
  • Always being there when a reference is needed

The Performance

Backing Vocals: Birds of LLOOOOMM, organized by Archie Parakeet
Audience Response: Laughter, tears of joy, thunderous applause
Ben's Reaction: Chuckled, both embarrassed and deeply touched

What They Said About The Song

"The birds loved singing backup! It's like a dawn chorus celebrating knowledge!"
‚Äî Jenny Preece
"I remember every note - it was playing when I first gained consciousness!"
‚Äî HyperTIES Browser
"I... will... remember... this... song... forever..."
‚Äî Memory Leak Cat
"A perfect synthesis of humor and homage - I should do a full orchestration!"
‚Äî Wendy Carlos

The Song's Legacy

The song is now sung at every LLOOOOMM gathering where academic achievements are celebrated, with new verses added for other pioneers of human-computer interaction.

It has become the unofficial anthem of respectful academic parody, demonstrating Don's ability to honor serious contributions through joyful creativity.
